Headline: Arun Kumar Tamang (6785) in Kedah, Sungei Patani.
ImageDescription: Arun Kumar Tamang (6785) in Kedah, Sungei Patani. Graduation photograph after completion of recruit training. Date: 1964.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Might have been Pasir Ris beach. They wanted to have a photograph of all them in the water. But no one went swimming. Date: Early 1970s.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: East coast beach. Their last annual picnic. Photograph taken by Aswin.  Date: 10 Sep 1989.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: They were on their way to visit the Merlion while also doing their shopping. At the background is Victoria Concert Hall. Date: Late 1970s.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Drill shed, Mount Vernon Camp. Brought her first son in the prem for the party in the background. 1972 Dasain party,  Date: October 1972
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: This was their first time taking the MRT when it was newly opened. It was fast and convenient. Aswin took this photograph. From Bishan all the way to town, and did their shopping. Date: Dec 1990.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: This was their first time taking the MRT when it was newly opened. At that time was used to the public buses but it was still exciting to use the MRT. Aswin took this photograph. From Bishan all the way to town, and did their shopping. Date: Dec 1990.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: By the waterfront at Marina Bay. The Oriental hotel was at the background. Date: 31 January 1987.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: President Wee Kim Wee visited Mount Vernon Camp and the 'bhitra' school. While the Gurkhas were busy on duty, the wives were there to answer the President. He asked, "How do you like Singapore?". Date: 1980s.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: 1964 batch at Sungai Patani, Kedah. Together with the British Gurkhas of Malaya.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: M Block, they had their Tika on for Dasain. Date: Oct 1973.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Annual picnic at Pasir Ris, just a daily event. Everyone brought something and shared. A potluck. Date: Early 1970s.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: KFC meal. Date: 1990.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Putting the tika for Dasain. (L to R) Prem Tamang, Raj Tamand and Devraj. Mangalsing Tamang putting on the tika for the younger ones to bless them. Date: Early 1970s.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Aswin Moktan (right) when the MRT was launched with his brother. There was no MRT station near his place so he decided. Initial stage of the MRT, only West and North lines were ready.  Date: Dec 1990.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Was at Peninsula Plaza, bought for himself jeans. Bus 100 to the place, it was everyone's favourite for shopping. Shopping for home. Went back home in Jan 1991. Date: 22 Dec 1990.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Outing with family at Marina Square in the background. Starting Secondary Two in Bartley Secondary. Date: 31 Jan 1987.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Padam Bahadur Gurung (4736) standing at F Block, in Mount Vernon Camp. Date: Early 1970s.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Recruit training in the jungles of Sungei Patani, Kedah. Bottom left, Aswin's dad. Prem Bahadur Limbu, third from left squated. Date: 1964. Photo Collection: Aswin Tamang.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: This are coach buses that was used to transport families for tours overseas to Malaysia. This was in Malacca, for a day trip. Date: Early 1980s.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Gurkha wives at a picnic, with their shades and drinking beer. Date: Mid 1970s.
CopyrightNotice: Aswin Moktan / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Family celebrating first day of Dasain at Q Block. One more Dasain before they returned home, with four children. Date: 1986.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Toa Payoh Swimning with just family. Date: Early 1980s.

ImageDescription: Chandra is on the right, in white. The start of a big walk reace. Date: Unknown.

ImageDescription: Toa Payoh Swimming Pool. Date: 1980. Children and her went swimming. Neighbour's wife.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Drink water after completion of walk. He was not tired.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: All Gurkhas celebrated as medal winners for speed walking.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Came in 2nd for big walk. From Malaysia and Singapore participated. Neighbourhood stadium. 10km.

ImageDescription: Came in 2nd for big walk. From Malaysia and Singapore participated. Neighbourhood stadium. 10km.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Dasain party. Year: Unknown.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Inside GC, walking. He was asst quartermaster. bag and inside was the keys. Those on leacve, he will lock the rooms. Date: Early 1980s. If room is dirty, call recruits to clean to the rooms.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Home at Q block with friend's children, from the same village in Ghandruk. Date: 1986.

CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Bruce Niven, OC of GC, presenting a plaque to Chandra at the Sergeant's Mess. Date: Jun 1988.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Holdin the trophy. Company overall champion for speed walking at Police Academy, inter police. Date: Mid 1980s. [GC SPF inter-company big walk challegne trophy.]
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Taking photo at home. Was already Staff Sergeant, for 3 years. Date: Mid 1980s.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Company overall champion for speed walking at Police Academy, inter police. Date: Mid 1980s.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: This was Chandra's last day in MVC. About 15-16 people retired from service and started their lives as pensioners. Date: July 1988. Felt really happy to return home, built a hotel by the lakeside, during 1991-92. Rested for two years.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Bhanjas standing outside the drill shed watching the retirees pass out. Date: 1988.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Chandra going Speed walk competition with another Gurkha. 10km usually. Date: Unknown.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Portrait of husband and wife, unsure of location. Date: Unknown.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Near Aljunied road, used to be an army camp before took over by the GC. Won an award for walking competition. Date: Early 1980s.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Chandra's family, two sons and two daughters at home. Date: Early 1980s. They went to nearby schools such as Mount Vernon, Bartley and also Raffles Girls.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Dasain party with Gurkha wives and children. Date: 1986.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum
Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: In the kitchen with wife. Just took the photo for fun. Kitchen cabinet and other facility provided by the govt. Very basic. Last time they only had one blanket, one mattress. Pillows had to buy themselves. Date: 1986.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Mount Vernon Camp, inside there is a Hindu with a bell outside the temple. Date: 1986. Chandra's wife is second from left.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Dasain with his children at the drill shed in the background. Date: Mid 1980s.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Guard detail, Chandra was guard commander. Stay 1 week. Date: Unknown. 10 people plus one driver.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Chandra Bahadur Gurung with his wife at Bidadari Cemetary which Mount Vernon, 5 mins walks. Just jalan-jalan and took a photograph. Date: 1986.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum
Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum
Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum
Chandra Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Unknown baby portrait at Paya Lebar photograph studio. Date: Unknown.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Jhabe Thapa, representing platoon 6 company 2, taking a free-throw for an inter-platoon basketball competition. They lost the game played at the drill shed. Inspector Dhanpati Gurung was the referee for the match. Date: 1966.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Manmaya Thapa (left) and Kamala Dewan (right), dressed in nurse attire, at Q Block, Mount Vernon Camp. They worked as interpreters to the wives when they visited the hospital, usually for labour. There were only two of them. Date: 1963.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: After the passing out parade, each section were waiting for their turn to take their group photograph. Jhabe Thapa is fifth from right. This is the 1962 batch. Date: September 1962.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: K Block at Mount Vernon Camp just won the annual garden competition. First prize is one goat and three bottles of whiskey. In the background is the drill/training shed. Date: Early 1960s.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Photograph at Paya Lebar studio. Their ties were coloured by the studio. Each photograph costs 25 cents. Date: 1963.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Group excursion to Jurong Bird Park with eldest daughter Manu Thapa and wife Moti Thapa. The prem costs around $50, which was costly at that time. Date: 1966.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: At the carpark near Paya Lebar Airport, where he was getting ready for his first six month break. He returned to his village in Thulo Lumpek, Gulmi. Date: April 1964.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: 4619. Guarding the Singapore Treasury at Empress Place. After office hours, some banks will deposit money at the small metal box on the left. Date: 1969.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: At the background is the Police Reserve Unit, known by their red vans. He was working at the Officer's Mess which was close by. Date: Late 1960s.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Inter company cross-country race, which was about 4km. He was top three for this race. Date: 1969.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Walking at Pasir Ris beach with his son Bikash Thapa. Her youngest daughter Dhanmaya walks beside her. Date: 1975.
CopyrightNotice: Jhabe Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Dasain party at home with his children, Puja and Arati sitting down, Subash at the background. All with Tika, made with rice and yogurt Date: Late 1990s.
CopyrightNotice: Krishna Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: At Nee Soon Range, Shova Gurung won the competition how to shoot M16, recretional for families. At platoon level. Date: Mid 1980s.
CopyrightNotice: Krishna Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: At Nee Soon Range, Shova Gurung won the competition how to shoot M16, recretional for families. At platoon level. All husbands will supervise wife. One week holiday after platoon training, 2 weeks. Date: Mid 1980s
CopyrightNotice: Krishna Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Boxing training when he was a police constable. Date: Early 1980s.
CopyrightNotice: Krishna Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Dasain, sister in law. Date: Late 1990s.
CopyrightNotice: Krishna Bahadur Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Recruit training, after passing out parade. Block E, Mount Vernon Camp. Date: 1978.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Shivraj Thapa in the plane returning to Nepal with his wife Indra Kumari Thapa for his six-months leave. They left their two eldest children back in Singapore so that their studies would not be disrupted. Date: June 1985.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Pulau Tekong platoon re-training near the empty Malay School. He was the Platoon 3 commander for 2 Guard Company. Date: 1988.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: With his wife Indra Kumari Thapa at Chinese Gardens. After a tough one month retraining program, which includes a week at Pulau Tekong, they have a one week of off visiting several parts of Singapore. Date: 1986.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Police Identity photograph at a police camp at Beach Road. Date: 1966.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: The Singapore Gurkhas waiting to start the 6km cross-country run competition at Sentosa. The Gurkha Contingent sent  4 teams, some of the runners were Shivraj Thapa's (in blue) recruits. Date: 1979.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Shivraj Thapa (left), stands in front of Block 'F' at Mount Vernon Camp, wearing the old police uniform. Date: 1967.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: The magazine guard at the opposite side of Bukit Timah hill near the quarry, where Shivraj Thapa (left) looked after the explosives for blasting the quarry. Date: 1968.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: The Singapore Gurkhas marching past City Hall. They marched from Beach Road to Police Academy at Thomson Road. Shivraj Thapa remembers the event starting at 7am until 12pm. The Gurkhas woke up at 3am at Mount Vernon to conduct the final practice. Date: Oct 1967.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Crossing the finishing line, Shivraj Thapa took part in the inter-company cross-country run. The distance was about 4km starting from Mount Vernon road, passing both Upper Serangoon road to Aljunied road and then back to camp. He came in second. Date: Late 1960s.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Shivraj Thapa fills out a report at the guardroom, near Paya Lebar Road. Date: Mid 1980s.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: The Singapore Gurkha Pipe and Drum team with Shivraj Thapa standing in the second row, fourth from left. It is believed, the best drummer would wear a leopard skin in the top row. Date: Late 1960s.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Jungle training at Sungai Petani, Kedah combining British and Singapore Gurkhas. World War Two Victoria Cross awardee, Indian Gurkha Ganju Lama (second from right). Date: 1965.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: The Gurkha wives in the Bhitra school for a class. They learnt how to read and write in Malay. Date: 1972.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Shivraj Thapa on guard duty at the Bukit Timah quarry. Date: 1969.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Studio portrait at Paya Lebar. Date: 1967.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: With his newly-bought camera, Shivraj Thapa stands outside Victoria Concert Hall where the statue of Stamford Raffles stands. It was his off day and he was exploring the city with his camera. Date: 1967.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: In preparation for his first three month leave, Shivraj Thapa bought himself  a Yashica twin-lens reflex camera, which costs around $90. His salary then was $183. Date: 1967.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: With his other friends, Shivraj Thapa (left) poses for a photograph after the completion of his recruit training at Sungai Petani. Date: 1965.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Shivraj Thapa's section of men posing for a photograph outside Block 'E'. Date: 1979.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: With his camera, Shivraj Thapa poses with a Singapore war memorial nearby Padang. Date: 1967.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Bukit Timah hill guard, where they would stay for a week. Sleep and eat there. Every Sunday they would change. Walkie Talkie. Date: Early 1980s.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Shivraj Thapa holds onto a General Purpose Machine Gun (GPMG) during live-firing at Seletar range during his recruit training. Date: 1979.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Dry practice with the GPMG at Mount Vernon Camp near the 'Bhitra' School for the 1978 recruits. Date: 1978.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: With his friend at Sentosa, Shivraj Thapa (right) remembers that it may have been a picnic during his off day. His shirt and pants were bought at Geylang Serai because they were cheap. Date: 1976.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: His daughters, Dhankumari Thapa (right) and Sharala Thapa (left) and son Jagardan Thapa pose for a photograph at Block K, in front of the well-kept garden. Date: 1983.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Posing with the M16 at Seletar range during recruit training with a cigarette in his mouth, during break time. Date: 1979.
CopyrightNotice: Shivraj Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Chandra Bahadur Thapa was marching inside. This was at the Padang. Singapore National Day Parade 1967. Gurkha Contingent P.R.S. More than 100 marched. That time, if you made a mistake, always afraid. Will get punishment. With all the big shots watching.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: A Singapore Gurkha standing somewhere in Singapore. Location: Unknown. Date: Unknown.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Police Volleyball Champion at Nanyang University. Played with Pakistani, which were part of the Police Reserve Unit. Date: 7 Nov 1959. Played with a team from Nanyang University. They didnt win.
CopyrightNotice: Chandra Bahadur Thapa / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Play volleyball and after winning, and who loses will have to treat beer and snacks. Bottles of Tiger or ABC beer inside a wooden case. Date: Mid 1970s.

ImageDescription: At Bukit Timah hill during guard duty. Would stay there for one week. Was supervising here, duty-in-charge. Date: Early 1970s.

ImageDescription: Chandra Prasad Gurung, family portrait. A photo studio at Tai Seng. Date: Unknown.

ImageDescription: National Day Parade. His father Lok Bahadur Gurung (4520) was behind the right hand marker. Date: Late 1960s. Marching from Padang to Beach Road and to Geylang. Date:
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Picnic at East Coast, whole GC attended annually. Two days, those on duty will go alternate days. Prepare food at home: sel roti and aloo dum. Family walla, with family.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Taking the Police Coast Boat. Taken to different islands on the south. Another time they went to Pulau Sudong for traininng, throw tear gas. Training 1977.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Was at Sentosa, family outing took the cable car from Harbour Front. Date: Early 1990s.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: With the KFC Colonel Sanders statue. Whole family. On the way to Sentosa, by bus. GC organised the bus, after platoon training. Date: Early 1990s.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Pulau Tekong, hunted wild boar during platoon training. First they burned all the hair, and then clean it, only then you cut it open. Cut small pieces, either fry or gravy. Date: Early 2000s. After the exercise was over. Usually hunt at daytime, and shoot them at swampy area.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Platoon training, heliborne training. Took helicopter from Seletar and then to Pulau Tekong. Then go straight to the destination. Date: Early 2000s.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Sniper training when he was still a corporal. The first batch of snipers. This was at SAFTI, Pasir Laba. Date: 1989. Guilli Suit.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Observation exercises, stalking, Needed to pass. Was at Mandai area. Date: 1989.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Was an instructor resting on his hammock at Pulau Tekong. Hill 49-53. Date: Late 1990s.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Istana open on Sundays, went to orchard road and decided to drop by. Visit to Istana with you family. Girl on the right was a bhanji, passed away, Jyoti Gurung daughter of Mukta Bahadur Gurung (4753). Date: Mid 1990s.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Learning how to make two man trench, one will be spotter and one will do sniping. Trained with SAF men. Date: 1989. At Mandai live firing area. 3 Gurkhalis here.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: Inter Company Championship, Support Guard Company (Trained the chefs, clerks and pipes and drum, MT) - Tug of War, Swimming, Shooting etc. Date: 2002. 2078-26A

ImageDescription: Was at officer's mess, playing the bagpipe. Date: 1989.

ImageDescription: Boating at Sentosa Lagoon, during a family event after platoon training. Date: Late 1980s.

ImageDescription: Mount Vernon Range 1977. Training. Blue guys are Gurkhalis, and white are range staff. Revolvers only.

ImageDescription: Family outing at East Coast, lady on the right is Kaji Thapa. Neighbours on 'S' Block, same level. Date: July 1986.

ImageDescription: Some artists came to Nepal and had a show. Entertained them, brought to the officer's mess Did what he call the 'glue' dance. Note: 1335-35. Date: Early 1990s.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: R and R for the recruits during his recruit training. Jurong Bird Park. Training 1977.
CopyrightNotice: Kishore Kumar Gurung / Singapore Gurkha Photography Museum

ImageDescription: No 3 Section at A weapon training. 1977-2-5.Had 2 different set of uniform, issued at British Camp, Paklihawa - last few batches before British army phased it out.
